intro: Erythrina grisebachii, commonly known as the Grey-leaf Coral Tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has palmate leaves composed of three to five leaflets, and its woody structure makes it a distinctive ornamental species. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub. Erythrina grisebachii is also valued for its hardiness and ability to withstand drought conditions.
